block.p: The Knicks were on the brink of trading Patrick Ewing, the cornerstone of their team for the past 15 years, but a four-team deal that would have sent him to Seattle unraveled last night. The Detroit Pistons, who were to acquire seven lesser-known players, called off the trade over contract considerations. The Knicks would have acquired Vin Baker from the SuperSonics and Glen Rice and Travis Knight from the Lakers.
